title: Cannot login to my comcast email with Thunderbird.
content: I have been having trouble logging into comcast with Thunderbird for a long time. I often get an error message and the only solution is shutting down Thunderbird and turning off my Norton VPN, then restarting Norton, and then restarting Thunderbird. This usually works. Starting about an hour ago, I can't connect to comcast with Thunderbird no matter what I do. I can access my email on comcast with their software, but I much prefer Thunderbird. Is this a Thunderbird problem or a comcast problem?

title: SMTP instellingen Outlook account
content:
Mijn Outlook (hotmail) mailaccount werkt niet goed meer in Thunderbird. Ontvangen lukt inmiddels weer (IMAP instellingen aangepast volgens de gegevens van Microsoft) maar de SMTP server kan ik niet juist instellen en verzenden lukt niet.

Microsoft Support zegt: SMTP server name smtp-mail.outlook.com SMTP port 587 SMTP encryption STARTTLS Authentication Method OAuth2/Modern Auth

Ik heb in Thunderbird (V128.2.3esr (64-bits)) echter niet de keus voor OAuth2/Modern Auth voor STARTTLS (en ook niet voor SSL). StartTLS en normaal wachtwoord werkt niet.

Wat moet ik doen? Dank alvast, Bastienne
creator: bastiennewentzel

Grazie mille in anticipo.

title: IMAP messages are not downloading properly
content:
I have several users who are not downloading some emails correctly. I am attaching an image so you can see how some emails are displayed (it is poorly encoded).

The solution to make the emails appear correctly again is to repair the folder. All the emails are repaired and appear correctly, but the next day some emails are downloaded incorrectly again and we have to repair them again.

We have been repairing the folders of 6 users for 3 days in a row.

Is there a problem with the latest version of Thunderbird regarding this? How can we solve it so we don't have to repair the folder every day?

Thanks

title: if i delete thunderbird from laptop, and redownload, will my messgaes and folders reappear?
content: Hi all :).... thanks in advance for reading my issue. My partner is in Austria, she is not PC/tech competent (me neither to be clear!)... I have been helping with quick assist)...thunderbird suddenly blocked sending messages and refused to accept the password (it works elsewhere and is correct)... first issue seemed to think we are spammers. somehow we got round that but now sending just hangs and does not complete. She has hundreds and hundreds of emails in message pane and in a long list of folders. Her provider is BT mail (IMAP/SMTP). Send & receive via gmail on the same laptop works ok. She has painstakingly set up thunderbird to work in a way she can understand and she prefers it to BT webmail (which also works ok - send/receive). Saved passwords in Thunderbird are correct and we triple checked all the account & server settings and even tried variants/ports etc) Question: if we delete the thunderbird from the laptop (uninstall in programmes and features) and redownload from mozilla... will the messages and folders repopulate by default or when a new email server is added..... i seem to remember that somehow the new download sort of remembers the old programme (we tried something like that in the past).... her stache of folders and messages is critical. windows 10 and Bitdefender antivirus. Any thoughts or guidance much appreciated regards steve
creator: stepphen1

title: Thunderbird Calender issues with error code MODIFICATION_FAILED and Status Code: 2,147,500,037, null
content:
Been getting this error below using Thunderbird Daily 132.0a1 (2024-09-26) (64-bit) on Win11 Been happening ever since i added some recurring focus time to my calendar in gmail

An error occurred when writing to the calendar [work@Gmail.com]

Error code: MODIFICATION_FAILED Status Code: 2,147,500,037, null

Server Replied with 400 If you're seeing this message after snoozing or dismissing a reminder and this is for a calendar you do not want to add or edit events for, you can mark this calendar as read-only to avoid such experience in future. To do so, get to the calendar properties by right-clicking on this calendar in the list in the calendar or task view.
creator: teleter

title: emails won't 'send' from Thunderbird, but will directly from the internet provider's site
content:
About 2 weeks ago, I stopped being able to 'send'. I have found two solutions. Which is less bad? (a) or (b)? I prefer to use the SSL/TLS option for security. But my choice is between (a) overriding the default port vs (b) using STARTTLS for out-mail (with SSL/TLS still for in-mail). a) SSL/TLS for both in and out-mail In-mail port 993 default Out-mail port 587 ... by overriding default 465

b) SSL/TLS for in-mail In-mail port 993 default STARTTLS for out-mail Out-mail port 587 default
creator: joanreekie

title: Non riesco ad usare account email Outlook con Thunderbird
content: Gentilissimi, non riesco più a ricevere o inviare posta tramite i miei indirizzi email Outlook. Il problema è che seguendo tutti i suggerimenti indicati nella vostra guida, e provando a re-inserire il mio indirizzo email Outlook con tutti i parametri corretti (imap: outlook.office365.com, porta 993; smtp: smtp.office365.com, porta 587, per entrambi autenticazione Oauth), ottengo questo messaggio di errore: "Errore durante la creazione dell'account - Il server in entrata è già presente". Ho provato a fare una ricerca riguardo a questo messaggio di errore che in molti hanno, ma senza soluzione. Sapete come risolverlo? Grazie anticipatamente e un cordiale saluto Sofia

title: Subject encryption
content:
What is the encryption used to encrypt the subject in Thunderbird email?

I know the PGP is used to encrypt the body/attachments of the email. Is PGP also used to encrypt the subject? If not, what is used for encryption? Is it something like AES256 or something else?

I tested this out with others that do/do not use Thunderbird. It seems that the ... that appears when the subject is encrypted is no problem when the other person also uses Thunderbird and they can read the subject but when a email is sent to someone not using Thunderbird and do use PGP they can open the body of the email and read the details and get attachments but they cannot view the subject, all they see are the ... in the subject area.

This is one of the reasons I'm interested in the answer and also to be able to explain to others why they should start using Thunderbird so we can have encrypted subjects also but I need to know the technical details of the encryption usesd for the subject data. The more details and/or links to articles about this would be great, I've tried looking before sending this message but cant find details about this.

Thanks for helping!
creator: bev22
